summary: REQ-1 (bootstrap specified principal as admin on install/upgrade without removing existing admins) is not implemented: the new migration does not modify access-control state, and main.mo no longer bootstraps any reserved admin (and the commented principal differs from the requested one). Additionally, project_state.json changes appear unrelated to the BuildRequest.

missing_requirements.requirement: Grant Internet Identity principal `zq4an-uqz34-isqap-u5moy-4rxll-vz3ff-ndqph-gvmn5-hqe6u-o6j3v-yqe` the `#admin` role in backend access-control state, including bootstrapping on fresh install/upgrade when no admins exist, without removing/downgrading existing admins.
missing_requirements.reason: No code in the diff assigns `#admin` to the specified principal during initialization or migration. The added migration function returns state unchanged, and main.mo only contains commented-out bootstrapping for a different principal, explicitly stating bootstrapping is 'handled in migration' (but migration does nothing).

hallucinated_features.description: Added/updated project tracking metadata (project_state.json) describing feature requests and status.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested by the BuildRequest; requirements focus solely on backend access-control bootstrapping for a specific principal.

hallucinated_features.description: Introduced a migration module and wired migration into the actor, but it performs no upgrade logic (no-op migration).
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest allows modifying/adding migration only if needed to preserve/upgrade stable state; the added migration does not implement the requested admin bootstrap and may be unnecessary as-is.
